content:
#28604 by @Junyan Xu adds two new typeclasses called NonAssocCommSemiring and NonAssocCommRing. Do we want two more classes in the ring hierarchy? When asked for motivation, he mentioned "Jordan algebras", which are characterised by two identites:

  1. xy = yx
  2. (xy)(xx) = x(y(xx))
Jordan algebras are a perfectly real thing, I've even seen whole conferences about them.
yeah sure, we want them. But since they are always commutative, we should probably make the normed PR about commutative ones. This is an aside for myself as a reminder.
